comments.author: Steven Duffy

comments.text:
Good question... for one I enjoyed the movie too. It also has a message 
that two different people so opposed can find a bond when their destination 
is the same. The movie reveals the growth of respect in their relationship 
through sharing adversity together on their reluctantly shared journey. 
This particular scene is of their wrong way on a highway realization. Who 
was right and who is wrong is not the issue -- we all have occasions to 
come to the realization we're blindly rambling the wrong way.

I am truly sorry if this has bothered you guys so much... Thanks for taking 
so much time to share your points of view and questions. Merry Christmas
comments.author: MikeConnie Brown

limited understanding of God. God never promises longer life in this world,

comments.text:
+xIegionx
Del and Neal thought they were going to die (as a result of the accident).  
After dead bodies decompose, they become skeletons.  Neal "saw" Del as the 
Devil because he felt guilty over his sins and assumed he was hell-bound.

comments.text:
+rogerpenna When I first saw this on VHS years ago, I could've sworn you 
could see the yellow line briefly through the snow, and I'd always assumed

comments.text:
Interstates have a shoulder on the outside of the lane, not the inside. He 
looked down and noticed there was no shoulder which told him they were on 
the wrong side of the road.
comments.author: Kopihucky

comments.text:
I understand it not being clear.  There was an entire scene before this, 
that would have helped it make more sense...

This was asked before on this video in an older post.  John Candy earlier 
in the movie, either fell asleep, OR some kind of other deal, while he was 
driving.  He fixed/corrected what was wrong, BUT he did not notice that he 
was no longer on the right lane of the road going in whatever direction was 
the correct direction.  This was an Interstate where roads parallel, where 
the median separates the two roads, with multiple lanes, going in opposite 
directions.

Then this scene happens.  So, John Candy is going in the opposite direction 
that he should have been going, thinking that the couple yelling at them 
are in the next lane, not across the median, on the opposite road of the 
Interstate.  Basically, he was on a head on collision with any upcoming 
traffic, which of course, ended up being the two 18-wheelers, which was 
HILARIOUS!!

I was with my parents the first time that was saw this on a VCR.  We were 
killing ourselves laughing!!!
